title: My low priority queue
body: so i have been leaving and rejoining a few games back in my league of legends history and i got up to my second low priority queue and i was up to my last match made game and when in mid game i had to leave to eat lunch (this is a intro co op game btw) and when i came back we came up to the late game so i started playing and we finished it and when we came to the post game stats i was given a msg saying that because i was leaving but rejoined im still gunna get another low priority queue for leaving and rejoining a intro game co op againts bots where my team mates also said they didnt mind me leaving and it was ok so do you think that request is a little harsh now i have to wait every 20 mins to get into a game because of me leaving and rejoining a into bot co op game whilst my team mates said it was ok for me to leave so plz take it off???

replies.body: sorry that we dont have good enough money for you
It's an awful habit and you deserve it.
its not a habit most of the time i leave because of internet problems

I honestly don't believe you should be given penalties for AFKing in bot games, unless it is just that you AFK in them like... every game. Let's be honest, they don't matter as much and the bots AFK too. Yeah, it sucks, but it is not competitive play which puts people at a disadvantage. It should be a lot harder to get penalties in bot games.

Summoner's Code applies to all games, hell if you use scripts or glitch abuse in a custom game you will still be permabanned for that. Even if you are the only human player in that custom game.

No exceptions for any queue type is how it should be.

>
> Summoner's Code applies to all games, hell if you use scripts or glitch abuse in a custom game you will still be permabanned for that. Even if you are the only human player in that custom game.
> 
> No exceptions for any queue type is how it should be.

I'm not trying to say there shouldn't be any penalty, but I just think it should be more lenient. I see the point of what you are saying though, because someone who leaves somewhere is likely to leave somewhere else as well.
You deliberately left a game for a reason you should already have been aware of. You deserve an additional 20 games of low priority for that.

No because if they changed the system for re-connecting, people would afk for a period, re-join at some point later in the game (And there are plenty of sties to tell you if a game is still going so you can know when you should reconnect and get around the leaver-buster system.

IIRC, the only game-type that doesn't ban you for leaving the game is the customs game type and you can play against bots there if you so desire. Even though one team says they're okay with it, it is a bad habit to get into.

Also, if you're leaving games because of internet problems, you should look into fixing that because that is more than enough reason to get you into trouble from the system.
